sentences.english: The animals were ruthlessly hunted to the verge of extinction.
sentences.chinese: 这些动物由于遭到无情的捕猎而濒于灭绝。

sentences.english: People hunt the ermine for its beautiful fur.
sentences.chinese: 人们捕猎白鼬，以获取它那美丽的毛皮。

sentences.english: Jeanie is right. Here Inuit can hunt and shoot-to-kill freely.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮没有说错，在这里，因努伊特人可以自由地捕猎。

sentences.english: The catchers were canoed back to their camp for up the river.
sentences.chinese: 捕猎者乘坐小独木舟回到远在河上游的营地。

sentences.english: When it comes to hunting, the females do the lion's share, in addition to raising the young ones.
sentences.chinese: 但在捕猎时，母狮在抚养幼狮之外还要给公狮一份。

sentences.english: Finally， those who hunter them must be punished severely.
sentences.chinese: 最后，对于捕猎珍稀野生动物的人必须严惩。

sentences.english: The American beaver has long been hunted for its velvety fur.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，人们捕猎美洲河狸，以获取它的绒毛皮。

sentences.english: Finally , those who hunt them must be punished severely.
sentences.chinese: 最后，对于捕猎珍稀野生动物的人必须严惩。

sentences.english: Wolf hunting, always the team attack, all do their bit.
sentences.chinese: 狼在捕猎时，总是团队出击，各尽其位。

sentences.english: The North American buffalo is a case of the near-extinction of a species through hunting.
sentences.chinese: 北美洲水牛便是因捕猎而濒临灭绝物种的一个例子。

sentences.english: Beavers were common in Britain until they were hunted to extinction centuries ago.
sentences.chinese: 海狸曾经在英国很常见，但几个世纪前因捕猎而灭绝。

sentences.english: Hunting like a pack of wolves, orca know no fear.
sentences.chinese: 杀人鲸捕猎时就像一群狼，无所畏惧。

sentences.english: You're probably not aware of thinking about cars while hearing about a jaguar's hunting habits.
sentences.chinese: 你不会想到汽车当你听到美洲虎的捕猎习惯的时候。

sentences.english: They will start hunting like wild animals.
sentences.chinese: 它们会像野生动物一样捕猎。

sentences.english: It was strangely easy to converse with this genteel hunter.
sentences.chinese: 与这个优雅的捕猎者交谈轻松得有些奇怪。

sentences.english: Thanks to these foolish girls, I didn't have to hunt for my preys .
sentences.chinese: 但也感谢这些愚蠢的女人，我就不用亲自去捕猎了。

definition: to prey on/to catch and feed on/to hunt for food
to hunt and kill (an animal or fish)
to forage/to hunt for food/to scavenge/fig. to make a living
